sen.j: 忌部氏（いんべし・いみべし）とは、大和時代から奈良時代にかけての氏族的職業集団である。
sen.e: Inbe-shi (also called imibe-shi) was a vocation-based group having characteristics of a clan, which existed from the Yamato period through the Nara period.
The Inbe clan (also called Imibe clan) was a vocation-based group having characteristics of a clan, which existed from the Yamato period through the Nara period.
sen.cmt: The Inbe clanに訂正しました。Imibe clanに訂正しました。
sen.e: The Inbe clan (also called Imibe clan) was a vocation-based group having characteristics of a clan, which existed from the Yamato period through the Nara period.

sen.j: ケガレを忌み、神事などに奉仕する。
sen.e: They shunned defilement and devoted themselves to such matters as divine service.
They shunned defilement and devoted themselves to such matters as divine service.
They shunned defilement and devoted themselves to such matters as divine service.

sen.j: 古来より宮廷祭祀における、祭具の製造・神殿宮殿造営に関わってきた。
sen.e: From olden times, they were engaged in the manufacture of ritual implements and the construction of shrines and palaces in relation to the religious rites in the Court.
From ancient times, they were engaged in the manufacture of ritual implements and the construction of shrines and palaces in relation to the religious rites in the Court.
From ancient times, they were engaged in the manufacture of ritual implements and the construction of shrines and palaces in relation to the religious rites in the Court.

sen.j: 祭具製造事業のひとつである玉造りは、古墳時代以後衰えたが、このことが忌部氏の不振に繋がる。
sen.e: Tamatsukuri (jewel making), one of the ritual implements manufacturing businesses, had gone downhill after the Kofun period (tumulus period), which led to the decline of the Inbe clan.
Tamatsukuri (jewel making), one of the ritual implements manufacturing businesses, had gone downhill after the Kofun period (tumulus period), which led to the decline of the Inbe clan.
Tamatsukuri (jewel making), one of the ritual implements manufacturing businesses, had gone downhill after the Kofun period (tumulus period), which led to the decline of the Inbe clan.

sen.j: アメノフトダマノミコト（天太玉命）を祖先とする。
sen.e: Amenofutodama no mikoto is their ancestor.
Amenofutodama no mikoto is their ancestor.
Amenofutodama no mikoto is their ancestor.

sen.j: その子孫は後に斎部を名乗る。
sen.e: Their posterity later used 斎部 (also read as Inbe) as the Kanji characters to express their family name.
Their posterity later used 斎部 (also read as Inbe) as the Kanji characters to express their family name.
Their posterity later used 斎部 (also read as Inbe) as the Kanji characters to express their family name.

sen.j: 中臣氏と勢力を争ったが、あまり振るわず、次第に衰退していった。
sen.e: Having been involved in a battle for power with the Nakatomi clan, and failed in gaining predominance over them, the Inbe clan gradually declined.
Having been involved in a battle for power with the Nakatomi clan, and failed in gaining predominance over them, the Inbe clan gradually declined.
Having been involved in a battle for power with the Nakatomi clan, and failed in gaining predominance over them, the Inbe clan gradually declined.

sen.j: 「諱部」、「鋳部」、「伊部」とも表記する例もある。
sen.e: There are cases where 'Inbe' is written as '諱部', '鋳部' or '伊部'.
There are cases where 'Inbe' is written as '諱部,' '鋳部' or '伊部.'
sen.cmt: コンマ、ピリオドの位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: There are cases where 'Inbe' is written as '諱部,' '鋳部' or '伊部.'

sen.j: 氏族は多数に及び、各地に広がっている。
sen.e: There were many people in the clan, who spread across Japan.
There were many people in the clan, who spread across Japan.
There were many people in the clan, who spread across Japan.

sen.j: 九州・紀伊半島・四国・房総半島などに勢力をもった。
sen.e: They were influential in such areas as Kyushu, the Kii Peninsula, Shikoku and the Boso Peninsula.
They were influential in such areas as Kyushu, the Kii Peninsula, Shikoku and the Boso Peninsula.
They were influential in such areas as Kyushu, the Kii Peninsula, Shikoku and the Boso Peninsula.

sen.j: アメノヒワシ（あめのひわしのみこと）を祖とする阿波国の阿波忌部氏、タオキホオイ（たおきほおひのみこと）を祖とする讃岐国の讃岐忌部氏、ヒコサシリ（ひこさしりのみこと）を祖とする紀伊忌部氏、クシアカルタマ（くしあかるたまのみこと）を祖とする出雲国の玉作氏（たまつくりし）、アメノマヒトツ（あめのまひとつのみこと）を祖とする筑紫国・伊勢国の忌部氏などがいた。
sen.e: The Inbe clan group included the Awa Inbe clan of Awa Province (Tokushima Prefecture) who had Amenohiwashi (Amenohiwashi no mikoto) as their ancestor, the Sanuki Inbe clan of Sanuki Province (Kagawa Prefecture) whose ancestor was Taokihooi (Taokihoohi no mikoto), the Kii Inbe clan whose ancestor was Hikosashiri (Hikosashiri no mikoto), the Tamatsukuri clan of Izumo Province (Shimane Prefecture), whose ancestor was Kushiakarutama (Kushiakarutama no mikoto) and the Inbe clan of Tsukushi Province (Kyushu) and Ise Province (Mie Prefecture).

The Inbe clan group included the Awa-Inbe clan of Awa Province (Tokushima Prefecture) who had Amenohiwashi (Amenohiwashi no mikoto) as their ancestor, the Sanuki-Inbe clan of Sanuki Province (Kagawa Prefecture) whose ancestor was Taokihooi (Taokihoohi no mikoto), the Kii-Inbe clan whose ancestor was Hikosashiri (Hikosashiri no mikoto), the Tamatsukuri clan of Izumo Province (Shimane Prefecture), whose ancestor was Kushiakarutama (Kushiakarutama no mikoto) and the Inbe clan of Tsukushi Province (Kyushu) and Ise Province (Mie Prefecture).
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。
sen.e: The Inbe clan group included the Awa-Inbe clan of Awa Province (Tokushima Prefecture) who had Amenohiwashi (Amenohiwashi no mikoto) as their ancestor, the Sanuki-Inbe clan of Sanuki Province (Kagawa Prefecture) whose ancestor was Taokihooi (Taokihoohi no mikoto), the Kii-Inbe clan whose ancestor was Hikosashiri (Hikosashiri no mikoto), the Tamatsukuri clan of Izumo Province (Shimane Prefecture), whose ancestor was Kushiakarutama (Kushiakarutama no mikoto) and the Inbe clan of Tsukushi Province (Kyushu) and Ise Province (Mie Prefecture).

sen.j: また、四国の阿波国と房総半島の安房国が何れも「あわ」と読むのは忌部氏が阿波から安房に行った際に命名されたとも言われている。
sen.e: Incidentally, it is said that Awa (阿波) Province of Shikoku and Awa (安房: Chiba Prefecture) Province of the Boso Peninsula have phonetically the same name because the latter province was named as such by the Inbe clan people of 阿波 when they migrated to it.

Incidentally, it is said that Awa Province of Shikoku region and Awa Province of the Boso Peninsula (Chiba Prefecture) have phonetically the same name because the latter province was named as such by the Inbe clan people of Shikoku region when they migrated to it.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記は不要と考え削除しました。region補足しました。括弧位置を訂正しました。the Inbe clan people of Shikoku regionに訂正しました。
sen.e: Incidentally, it is said that Awa Province of Shikoku region and Awa Province of the Boso Peninsula (Chiba Prefecture) have phonetically the same name because the latter province was named as such by the Inbe clan people of Shikoku region when they migrated to it.

sen.j: 北陸地方（越前国）、山陰地方（出雲国、隠岐国）、山陽地方（備前国）などにも忌部氏はいる。
sen.e: The Inbe clan spread in such regions as Hokuriku (Echizen Province; the eastern part of Fukui Prefecture), Sanin (Izumo Province, Oki Province; Oki Island of Shimane Prefecture) and Sanyo (Bizen Province; the south-eastern part of Okayama Prefecture).

The Inbe clan spread in such regions as Hokuriku (Echizen Province; the eastern part of Fukui Prefecture), Sanin (Izumo Province, Oki Province; Oki Island of Shimane Prefecture) and Sanyo (Bizen Province; the south-eastern part of Okayama Prefecture).

The Inbe clan spread in such regions as Hokuriku (Echizen Province; the eastern part of Fukui Prefecture), Sanin (Izumo Province, Oki Province; Oki Island of Shimane Prefecture) and Sanyo (Bizen Province; the south-eastern part of Okayama Prefecture).

sen.j: 竹取物語流布本にかぐや姫の名付け親を「みむろとのいんべのあきた」（三室戸斎部秋田）とあり、また竹取の翁の名を「さぬきのみやつこ」とある。
sen.e: In a popular edition of Taketori Monogatari (Tale of the Bamboo Cutter), the godfather of Kaguyahime (the Shining Princess) is 'Mimuroto no Inbe no Akita' and the name of the old bamboo cutter is 'Sanuki no Miyatsuko.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In a popular edition of Taketori Monogatari (Tale of the Bamboo Cutter), the godfather of Kaguyahime (the Shining Princess) is 'Mimuroto no Inbe no Akita' and the name of the old bamboo cutter is 'Sanuki no Miyatsuko.'

In a popular edition of Taketori Monogatari (Tale of the Bamboo Cutter), the godfather of Kaguyahime (the Shining Princess) is 'Mimuroto no Inbe no Akita' and the name of the old bamboo cutter is 'Sanuki no Miyatsuko.'

sen.j: それを、この氏族と結びつけ、作者を忌部氏の人とする説や、讃岐忌部と作者の関係を指摘する説がある。
sen.e: Based on these descriptions, some insist that the author of the tale was a person belonging to the Inbe clan, and others point out the relation between the author and the Sanuki Inbe clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Based on these descriptions, some insist that the author of the tale was a person belonging to the Inbe clan, and others point out the relation between the author and the Sanuki-Inbe clan.
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。
sen.e: Based on these descriptions, some insist that the author of the tale was a person belonging to the Inbe clan, and others point out the relation between the author and the Sanuki-Inbe clan.

sen.j: 織田氏は劔神社の神官である越前忌部（斎部）氏の支流（あるいは越前藤原氏とも）であるが、後に桓武平氏の系統と仮冒した。
sen.e: The Oda clan is a branch lineage of the Echizen Inbe (忌部 or 斎部) clan, a Shinto priest family of Tsurugi-jinja Shrine, (or of Echizen Fujiwara clan according to another opinion), but they later misrepresented their lineage as having been descended from the Kanmu-Heisi (the Taira clan).

The Oda clan is a branch lineage of the Echizen-Inbe clan, a Shinto priest family of Tsurugi-jinja Shrine, (or of Echizen-Fujiwara clan according to another opinion), but they later misrepresented their lineage as having been descended from the Kanmu-Heisi (the Taira clan).
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。漢字表記は不要と考え削除しました。
sen.e: The Oda clan is a branch lineage of the Echizen-Inbe clan, a Shinto priest family of Tsurugi-jinja Shrine, (or of Echizen-Fujiwara clan according to another opinion), but they later misrepresented their lineage as having been descended from the Kanmu-Heisi (the Taira clan).

sen.j: 長徳4年（998年）3月21日、藤原行成の「権記」に越前劒大神宮神主 伊部守忠という名前が見える。
sen.e: A reference is made to INBE (伊部) no Moritada in the section of March 21, 998 of 'Gonki', a diary of FUJIWARA no Yukinari, as a Shinto priest belonging to Echizen Tsurugi-daijinja Shrine.
A reference is made to INBE no Moritada in the section of April 25, 998 of 'Gonki,' a diary of FUJIWARA no Yukinari, as a Shinto priest belonging to Echizen Tsurugi-daijingu Shrine.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記は不要と考え削除しました。グレゴリオ暦に訂正しました。コンマの位置を訂正しました。Tsurugi-daijingu Shrineに訂正しました。
sen.e: A reference is made to INBE no Moritada in the section of April 25, 998 of 'Gonki,' a diary of FUJIWARA no Yukinari, as a Shinto priest belonging to Echizen Tsurugi-daijingu Shrine.

sen.j: 四国の阿波、房総の安房に限らず、地名に関する事も多く、伊部（いんべ）、井辺（いんべ）、員弁（いなべ）など三重県や奈良県にも同氏から付けられた地名を残している。
sen.e: Not limiting to Awa of Shikoku or the Boso Peninsula, a number of place-names deriving from the clan's name exist; such as 伊部 (Inbe), 井辺 (Inbe) and 員弁 (Inabe) in such prefectures as Mie and Nara.

Not only "Awa" of Shikoku region or the Boso Peninsula, number of places that were named after Inbe in various Chinese characters deriving from the clan's name exist in such prefectures as Mie and Nara.
sen.cmt: region補足しました。漢字表記は不要と考え削除しました。それに伴い文章を訂正しました。
sen.e: Not only "Awa" of Shikoku region or the Boso Peninsula, number of places that were named after Inbe in various Chinese characters deriving from the clan's name exist in such prefectures as Mie and Nara.

sen.j: カバネははじめ首 (曖昧さ回避)（おびと）だったが、天武天皇9年（680年）1月8日に、連（むらじ）の姓を与えられた。
sen.e: Their kabane (clan title) was initially Obito (首) but they were awarded a kabane of Muraji (連) on January 8 of the Emperor Tenmu 9 (680).
Their clan title was initially Obito but they were awarded a title of Muraji on January 8, the 9th year of Emperor Tenmu's rein (in 680).
sen.cmt: 日本語表記、読みは不要と考え削除しました。the 9th year of Emperor Tenmu's rein (in 680)としました。
sen.e: Their clan title was initially Obito but they were awarded a title of Muraji on January 8, the 9th year of Emperor Tenmu's rein (in 680).

sen.j: 天武天皇13年（684年）12月2日に他の連姓の50氏とともに宿禰（すくね）になった。
sen.e: Then they were awarded Sukune (宿禰) on December 2 of the Emperor Tenmu 13 (684) together with other 50 Muraji's.
Then they were awarded Sukune on December 2 of the 13th year of Emperor Tenmu's rein (in 684) together with other 50 Murajis.
sen.cmt: 日本語表記、読みは不要と考え削除しました。the 13th year of Emperor Tenmu's rein (in 684) としました。'削除しました。
sen.e: Then they were awarded Sukune on December 2 of the 13th year of Emperor Tenmu's rein (in 684) together with other 50 Murajis.

sen.j: 『日本逸史』によると、延暦22年（803年）3月に「忌部」から「斎部」に改めた。
sen.e: According to Nihon Isshi (Supplemental History of Japan), the Inbe clan changed its kanji expression from 忌部 to 斎部.
According to "Nihon Isshi" (Supplemental History of Japan), the Inbe clan changed its kanji expression from '忌部' to '斎部.'
sen.cmt: 原文の『』に合せて" "補足しました。原文の「」に合せて' '補足しました。
sen.e: According to "Nihon Isshi" (Supplemental History of Japan), the Inbe clan changed its kanji expression from '忌部' to '斎部.'

sen.j: 正六位上斎部宿祢浜成の願出によるという。
sen.e: It is said to have been based on the request made by Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) INBE no Sukune Hamanari.
It is said to have been based on the request made by Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) INBE no Sukune Hamanari.
It is said to have been based on the request made by Shorokuinojo (Senior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) INBE no Sukune Hamanari.

sen.j: 浜成の伝記は伝わってないが、『古語拾遺』の選者斎部広成と同一人物という説もある。
sen.e: Although no biography of Hamanari has been handed down, some insist that he is the very same person with INBE no Hironari who wrote "Kogo shui" (Gleanings of Old Words).
Although no biography of Hamanari has been handed down, some insist that he is the very same person with INBE no Hironari who wrote "Kogo shui" (Gleanings of Old Words).
Although no biography of Hamanari has been handed down, some insist that he is the very same person with INBE no Hironari who wrote "Kogo shui" (Gleanings of Old Words).

sen.j: 忌部黒麻呂 - 万葉歌人
sen.e: INBE no Kuromaro - a Manyo kajin (one of the poets of Manyoshu)
INBE no Kuromaro: One of the poets of Manyoshu (the oldest anthology of tanka)
sen.cmt: ハイフンを: に訂正しました。万葉集の説明補足しました。万葉歌人の日本語読みは不要と考え削除しました。
sen.e: INBE no Kuromaro: One of the poets of Manyoshu (the oldest anthology of tanka)

sen.j: 斎部広成 - 古語拾遺を作成
sen.e: INBE no Hironari - author of "Kogo shui"

sen.e: Mochimitsu OE

sen.e: Nobunaga ODA - various opinions exist.
